item.title: Thoughts: Randomness Sparking My Life
item.description: Randomness Like many engineers, I like patterns and routines, but at the same time I value randomness in my life. Randomness brings momentum to life, but there is also the risk that it can threaten the normal course of life.

item.title: Ryuki Shimada
item.description: I’m a Ph.D. student at Keio University in Japan. I love to give shape to my ideas through coding. You can address me in English, Japanese or French. Research I study path/motion planning for a tethered mobile robot, which is anchored to a fixed base by a cable for power supply or communication. Currently I am focusing on motion planning that explicitly considers the impact of the cable on the environments.
